p: Twenty-one studies were identified for this domain; six articles qualified for data extraction of those five were extracted within the time frame (Table 2). Two studies were set in Sierra Leone [ 107, 114], two in Guinea [ 44, 114], one in Mali [ 32], and one in Liberia [ 46]. One study was set in more than one country [ 114]. Though there were a limited number of studies identified, they provided data from more than 4500 participants, including 1400 LF-positive people (Table 3). One study reported seroprevalence data from a rural region of Guinea [ 44], and a cohort study reported that LF IgM antibodies may persist for months to years [ 107]. The data shows that there are large gaps in evidence regarding the immune response to LF infection caused by different strains, in different at-risk populations and over time.
